course_title: Fundamental MRI of the Brain & Spine

learning_outcomes.description: recognise normal anatomy and some common pathologies
tailor a clinical MRI examination accordingly
be aware of appropriate patient care.

assessments.task_description:
• Description

10 Question (total 10 marks)

  • Instructions

Quiz questions are True/False, Multiple Choice, Multiple Answer or Short Answer, and are worth marks according to difficulty.

  • Duration

 The quiz duration is 30 minutes (from the start of the quiz).

This test is available from 13 August 9:00 to 14:00 16 August. This test can’t be saved. Once the quiz is started, it must to be completed within 30 minutes. The quiz will be submitted automatically once the time expires.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Video recording of PPT slides

Section 1 is a Brain case study (case will be provided by the course coordinator).

Section 2 is a Spine case study (case will be provided by the course coordinator).

Both cases must be answered

Maximum time for Video presentation is 5 minutes
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must submitted through BlackBoard (learn.uq.edu.au ). Click on https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/learnuq-blackboard-help/kaltura-media/submit-video-or-audio-assignment-kaltura for more information on how to submit video assignment
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Group assignment - Literature review

  1. Choose a topic (topics will be provided by the course coordinator)
  2. Create your research question
  3. Conduct your literature review
  4. Write up your literature review

Your paper should aim to be 2000 words (strictly limited to 1800 - 2200 words)

APA referencing style is recommended. 

The groups will be assigned by the course coordinator after the census date
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must submitted via TurnItIn, through BlackBoard (learn.uq.edu.au ). Detailed instructions on how to access and use TurnItIn will be provided at the beginning of the semester.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.

assessments.task_description: The examination is invigilated online exam through blackboard. You will have 10 minutes planning time followed by 1 hour to complete the exam. A further 15 minutes are allowed during which you must upload your exam to Blackboard. You will be advised of the date and time in which to complete the examination once the examination timetable has been determined. Note that late penalties will be strictly applied as per university policy.
